name: Star Island Resort and Club

reviews.text: we loved this resort!! i traveled with my husband and two kids ages 9 and 4. we had a great time. lots of activities for the kids at the pool everyday. my husband even got to go on a golf outing with other guests. unfortuntely i didnt get to use the spa so i cant comment on that. our room on the other hand was great! so much room and we only had the "B" side of the suite. which has the full kitchen and washer/dryer. **note if you dont research your accomadations you might get mixed up the "A" side of the suite is really small double beds and a sitting area. the "B" side is the larger with full kitchen. i write this because we only got the "B" side when we stayed because that was room enough for us, but the family that stayed in the "A" side during the last half of our vacation said they booked thinking that "A" meant it was the larger room. parking was never a problem. for shoppers there are stores everywhere within a mile or two. i have to say i did have to call for room service when we got there upon checking everything out i noticed there were no pillows on bed, and no extra blankets for the kids on pull out couch. they had them to our room within 30 minutes. then the most impressive thing was that they called after i had just answered door and made sure that the maid brought them to us and did i have any other concerns. the staff was great never had a problem. when we got there we were early and they said they would call us when room was ready and within 45 minutes and us checking out the grounds they called and we got to go to our room early.
reviews.title: loved star island

reviews.text: we stayed 2 weeks at this resort and the whole first week it rained but it didnt get us down. went to disney anyway. and they had pizza party and other get togethers at the upstairs bar. we had a great view from our own balcony. we watched the sun rise and set.
reviews.title: NOT A FIVE STAR RESORT

reviews.text: i do agree with some of the people on here that the decorations and carpet etc do need to be brought up to date but it didnt bother me (burgandys and pinks just arent my style). about the timeshare spill well we already own fairfield timeshare thats why we stayed here and so close to disney. we did go to it and they just updated us on our current timeshare and asked if we wanted to add to our current and we said no and there were no hard feelings and the saleslady didnt get snotty like one person said on here but maybe depends on person. plus we got $75.00 for our time in disney gift certificates and that really came in handy. i loved this resort and would recommend this resort to anybody.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel!!

reviews.text: My family and I just returned from this resort. I was not impressed with the mini suite. We could hear every thing from next door, mold on the ceiling,tastless decor. sheets with holes, towels with holes,two very cramped rooms with very small tv sets, A/C unit very loud. I could not relax or sleep in this place. the rooms where not well lit. I felt itchy when I entered the room. The main grounds very well kept. pool was very nice. They charge .75 for local calls. The mini suite does not sleep 6 the sofa bed had no cushion what so ever you can see the coils. my daughter had to sleep on it unopened. I have seen better rooms in three star hotels/motels than this. I don't know why anyone would by a timeshare with this type of room. We will try other timeshares base on recommendations from friends and family never again from site ads.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time!
Really Nice Place to Stay
reviews.text: We have just returned from our stay at Star Island Resort. I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews, but I can honestly say that this Hotel was really quite nice. Our check-in was no problem and we were able to get into our room right away (it was about 2:30 in the afternoon). We had suites A and B and there was ample room. The master bedroom was beautiful and we took advantage of our private jacuzzi...felt great after those long park days! The kitchen was fully equipped with everything that you would need. The washer and dryer came in handy as well. Although the decor is abit outdated, the room was very very clean. Loved the artistic way they would display the towels. Nice touch!! There was the odd bug but hey, it was pretty hot and humid so the odd insect is expected. Nothing to worry about! The grounds around the Hotel were equally clean. The gym was great. The pool was wonderful and there were alot of activities to take part in. The kids loved it!!! The staff at the spa were very gracious as well....had the best pedicure..thanks Lorena!! And it is nice and close to Walt Disney World....All and all we had a lovely stay at the Star Island Resort and I would recommend it to anyone!!!! Thanks Star Island!!!

We were there w/ our 16 year old baseball team for a tournament from Dec 26 - Jan 1. The team stayed in a combination of two 3-bedroom suites/condos (which sleeps 10 comfortably) and four 2-bedroom suites. We had a total (inc. players) of 35 people staying at Star Island resort and everyone thought it was a marvelous place. It is super clean and has a terrific staff that accomodated us when we requested more towels, blankets and sheets. They let us check in 3 hours early and let us checkout an hour late. They have daily activities which we couldnt participate in b/c of our baseball itinerary but would have if we had the chance. They offer dinner specials from area restaurants which are very good and affordable - not to mention convenient. The suites are beautiful and are huge. At times, we had most of the team in our unit for meetings and there was plenty of room. There's also a private balcony outside the units w/ a table and chairs. I really can't say enough good things about this resort. Our experience truly could not have been better. As far as it being a 5 star resort - I would give it 10 stars!!! We are definitely going back there next year b/c I think if we'd go anywhere else we'd be disappointed. Our entire team highly recommends this resort.
reviews.title: Excellent Place to Stay - we loved it!!!
Super place to stay
reviews.text: We booked a one week stay at the Star Island resort through an Interval International Getaway. We were very impressed. We stayed in a ground floor unit overlooking a waterway with fountains. The apartment was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. It was a one bedroomed unit with a fully equipped kitchen including a washing machine and tumble drier, a walk in shower, a jucuzzi etc. There were lots of activities and evening entertainment on the resort. it is just off the 192 so there are loads of restaurants nearby. We would definately stay here again.

reviews.title: Star Isalnd is great with us!!
reviews.text: My Mother, Sister and I all have 3 bedroom units here. For years and years we have had the best times here. The resort is off 192 and has great tennis, pools, and rooms.

OK the decor is a little dated. It would be nice if they had washer/dryer in each unit. The newer units have them in the rooms (B-side). We have to shlep down the elevator and use the free ones on the first floor. One incident happened one year and it was not the fault of the resort, a kid didn't have a swim diaper on and we had to leave the pool for 3 hours. Bummer. Parking can be a problem now with the new units, but this means you might have to WALK (oh no).
reviews.title: Very nice ! Liked It So Much We Purchased!
Very uneven experience 11-19-05 to 11-26-05
reviews.text: The grounds, pools and courts are always in great working order. The rooms were always very clean and huge. Never a problem that wasn't fixed in an hour or less. Complete kitchen with all you would need. I brought an orange juicer, and didn't need it; there was one in the room. TV in every room, with CD player and speakers the whirlpool jet bath is a great way to relax after the all day walking at the near by parks. And talk about things to do, there is Disney 10 min. from your front door. 20 min. away is one the top 10 BASS fishing lakes in the U.S. And there is plenty of shopping, everything from Flea markets to fine stores less than 30 min away. There are activities for adults and kids EVERYDAY. If you like tennis, there are plenty of courts, and the best part NO COURT FEES! Any other resort with this many courts would charge at least $10/hr.

reviews.title: Worst stay at a resort in my life!
reviews.text: Where to begin! Tacky decor, smelly rooms, no non-smoking rooms, windows that had to be kept open with a pot, old sheets, have to pay for housecleaning, not enough towels, loud bar (worse because we had to have the windows open - karaoke night), blowing leaves and cutting grass at 5 a.m., have to pay .75 cents everytime you pick up the phone, service was awful. No washer/dryer in room but on main floor of building (very old, tore my clothes). I would not recommend this resort to my worst enemy. We did the timeshare tour (very tacky) and we were paid $50 or discount at an event (I read on someone else's review they were paid $75!) We were told it would only take one hour and it took two! BIG BIG waste of our precious vacation time. We did find out during the tour a whole bunch of stuff that the front desk never informed us of! Need to upgrade, change management, and pay more attention to detail and service.
2nd time and everytime I love it.
reviews.title: Love it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Great service,rooms clean.
reviews.title: Very Average!

reviews.text: Close to all atractions, supermarkets and Lynx public transportation marker 11. Great for a person who don't want to drive in their vacation. They have shuttle to all atractions for $10 p/p roundtrip. You can't beat that since car parking in the park is $9.00.
reviews.title: Accomadating
Nice & relaxing
reviews.text: Recommend. No pushy salesperson
The title is exactly how I feel about this place, OUCH!
reviews.title: Ouch!
Great time by all
reviews.text: The timeshare owners ought to reconsider who they are using for management.

reviews.title: Horrible!
reviews.text: There is obviously a problem!
This place is a classic example of initial looks being deceiving.
reviews.title: Fairfield does not live up to the hype

reviews.text: I agree with other people who have stayed and feel from their experiences that this place is a SCAM.
reviews.title: More like a one and a half star resort

aka: Star Island Resort And Club Hotel Kissimmee
